actions.args: {"handle": "hacks", "community": {"tag": "hacks", "name": "DevHub Hacks", "addons": [{"id": "bi1ycv", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "telegram", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"handles\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"neardevhubhacks\\\\\\\"]}", "display_name": "Telegram"}, {"id": "5c99bm", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"GM fam! This community is all about hackathons. We\\\\u{2019}re here to build beyond the hype, crypto winter, pandemic, and war. We\\\\u{2019}re here to hack this world to perfection, or, at least, to being a better place through the power of BOS and blockchain technology.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Our groups\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe Hacks community consists of two main groups: \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to Hackathons and technical events on NEAR. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO, and hold grant takers accountable. They also engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- Maria Yarotska @yarotska.near\\\\\\\\n- Vlad Frolov @frol.near\\\\\\\\n- Oleksii Tarazevich @drtarazevich.near\\\\\\\\n- Nneoma Kanu @nneoma.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space to discuss and implement ideas around developer focused events in and beyond the Near ecosystem. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to meet with others to share ideas and submit proposals. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. The group has a dedicated Telegram channel as well as regular Twitter spaces. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Communication Channels**\\\\\\\\n- [DevHub Hacks Community Group in Telegram](https://t.me/+Pdipk3olNgw3NWMy)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How to get involved\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Join the community group\\\\\\'s dedicated [Telegram group](https://t.me/+Pdipk3olNgw3NWMy) to learn about the latest discussions and activities. Don\\\\u{2019}t forget to introduce yourself.\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to DevHub\\\\u{2019}s [Twitter account](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) to make sure you don\\\\u{2019}t miss our monthly Spaces hangout.\\\\\\\\n- Participate in discussions, comment on existing ideas, or propose new ideas.\\\\\\\\n- Volunteer to speak about a topic or be a co-host for a Twitter Space.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Overview"}, {"id": "iqll86", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to request support\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We are always on the lookout for events that align with our mission and provide value to the NEAR ecosystem. If you are organizing such an event, we would love to hear from you! Below is a guide on how to submit a sponsorship proposal to us.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Pre-Approval Criteria:**\\\\\\\\nYour proposal should address the following key areas that we use to evaluate event sponsorships:\\\\\\\\n1. Event Information: \\\\\\\\nProvide details about the event. This should include the scope, budget, target audience, goals, and expected outcomes of the event. (Refer to the template below)\\\\\\\\n2. Host Background: \\\\\\\\nTell us about your experience hosting similar events. Include past successes, what you\\\\\\'ve learned, and how you\\\\\\'ve grown your event-hosting skills.\\\\\\\\n3. Dev/Project Potential Stickiness: \\\\\\\\nExplain the relevance of the event to NEAR. Describe how the event will promote NEAR and foster growth in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n4. Post Execution Metrics: \\\\\\\\nAfter the event, we will be looking at these metrics to evaluate further possible collaboration:\\\\\\\\n5. Onboarded developers\\\\\\\\nProjects built on NEAR testnet/mainnet\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**How to Submit Your Proposal:**\\\\\\\\n- Go to the DevHub board.\\\\\\\\n- Click the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Idea/Solution\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" button.\\\\\\\\n- Create a new post using the template provided below and post it as an Idea.\\\\\\\\n- Allow us some time to assess and evaluate your proposal.\\\\\\\\n- Upon approval, receive an attestation of sponsorship.\\\\\\\\n- Congratulations! You\\\\\\'ve secured your sponsorship!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**PROPOSAL TEMPLATE**\\\\\\\\nUse this template to structure your proposal. Make sure to provide detailed responses to each point.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**[Your Organization] [Event Name] Proposal**\\\\\\\\n1. Event Introduction\\\\\\\\nProvide a brief explanation of your event, its overall goals, and its target audience.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Event Name] is a large festival designed for [target audience]. Our main goal is to promote [specific concepts or technology] among [target audience].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n2. Organizer Introduction\\\\\\\\nDescribe who you are, any relevant credentials you have, and why you\\\\\\'re the right person/team to organize this event.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Your Organization] is the regional hub for everyone interested in [specific activity or field]. We have organized numerous programs and events that have helped [target audience] to [specific outcomes].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n3. Event Impact\\\\\\\\nDescribe the expected outcome of the event, its significance in a broader context, and how it will further the goals of the field or community you\\\\\\'re working with.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"The [Event Name] will strengthen [Organization\\\\\\'s or Field\\\\\\'s Impact] in [region], and promote [specific concept or technology] to developers, builders, and creators in the region.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n4. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)\\\\\\\\nProvide the expected metrics the event aims to achieve, such as the number of attendees, number of projects developed, and so on.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"We expect to attract over [number] developers, with [number] hackathon participants, and at least [number] projects. The event will feature [number] prizes across [number] categories.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n5. Evaluation Factors\\\\\\\\nProvide the criteria for judging the event\\\\\\'s success, especially if it\\\\\\'s a competition.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Projects will be evaluated based on team composition, market potential, product innovation, business model, and growth strategy.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n6. Funding Request\\\\\\\\nProvide a detailed breakdown of the requested funding, showing exactly how the funds will be allocated.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"We are requesting [$amount] for [specific allocation of funds].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n7. Additional Information\\\\\\\\nInclude any further details, related links, or relevant attachments to support the proposal.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Link to additional resources]\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Get Support"}], "admins": ["yarotska.near", "frol.near", "drtarazevych.near", "nneoma.near"], "handle": "hacks", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiamrrlcm45b3ypk5afvqds7bqbyei3d7a2ttinnjwzbykhlavfbvy", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihnj2nk5lxsvu3x7vge2yrbiynvagxre5thqvhsirner5rocmdkam", "description": "Hackathons and meetups for Nearians around the world", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "A hub dedicated to hosting and supporting developer focused events for the global community of Near enthusiasts. Test", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": "https://t.me/neardevhubhacks"}}

{"inputs": {"tag": "she-is-near", "name": "She-is-Near", "handle": "she-is-near", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreibysr2mkwhb4j36h2t7mqwhynqdy4vzjfygfkfg65kuspd2bawauu", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Onboarding, educating, empowering women in near ecosystem.", "bio_markdown": "This is a sample text about your community.\\\\nYou can change it on the community configuration page."}}

{"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# Are we Rust yet?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nYes, but ...\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRust is the primary language used in the NEAR ecosystem, and the tools in Rust received a lot of love. Still, the Developer Journey for Rust Development on NEAR is not fully delivered even though all the pieces are already there!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Developer Journey of Application Developer on NEAR with Rust/Swift/Kotlin/... experience\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Welcome to NEAR!** - there are welcoming and supportive communities at [DevHub Communities](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities), [Discord](https://near.chat), [Telegram @neardev](https://t.me/neardev), and a number of regional hubs.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges: \\\\\\\\n    * The DevHub Communities catalog is still incomplete and hard to search unless you know the community you need.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s complete the catalog and provide various views on the DevHub\\\\\\'s communities list based on activity, area of involvement, etc._\\\\\\\\n    * Communities are still not discoverable peer-to-peer.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s do a better job of interlinking communities from each other (e.g. make regular posts with useful resources and links to other relevant communities)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2. **Get started** - there are [a number of examples](https://github.com/near-examples/), great local & [online development environment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near-new-project-template) thanks to [interactive CLIs](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), easy-to-use [contracts development framework](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs), and [integration testing framework](https://github.com/near/near-workspaces-rs).\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * There is no high-level picture of how all the tools fit together.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create one high-level map and reference it everywhere._\\\\\\\\n    * There is no recommended crash course into Rust to get productive with contract development.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s select and explicitly recommend to scan through those instead of learning the whole Rust book on day one. Those could be selected chapters from [Rust by example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/), [Google\\\\\\'s Comprehensive Rust Book](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/)._\\\\\\\\n    * Tools do not feature each other, which makes it harder to build a proper mental model.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s improve READMEs to have a unified look and provide references to other tools and relevant communities._\\\\\\\\n    * Testnet environment is not promoted.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s emphasize how it enables rapid experimentation._\\\\\\\\n    * Contract development best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how/when/why to use standards [NEPs], how to get the best out of the local storage, how to deal with data migration after contract upgrades, when it makes sense to use off-chain indexers)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n3. **Go to production** - it is easy to deploy to mainnet thanks to [cargo-near](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), and [NEAR RPC providers](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/introduction), [Indexers](https://docs.near.org/concepts/data-flow/data-storage), [Explorers](https://explorer.near.org), and SourceScan help to be productive and insightful.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * Developers need some NEAR tokens on mainnet to get things deployed.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create some pool with a semi-automated process where developers can come and request some NEAR for the development (public GitHub repo should be required to make the request)._\\\\\\\\n    * Preparing for production best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how to secure your contract account, how to ensure contract upgradability without full access keys, how to react to exploited vulnerabilities)._\\\\\\\\n    * Security considerations are often a major roadblock before going live.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s provide more automated tools to stress the code as much as possible (code coverage, generating tests with AI, etc)._\\\\\\\\n    * Collecting insights about the app usage is still hard.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s explore if RPC providers could offer anonymized aggregated insights about view function calls and some other metrics, chain analytics could also be easier._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n4. **Invite others** - many of us came to NEAR for the great tech and awesome community.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * We rely on the goodwill of our community members spreading the word.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s recognize our most prominent tech advocates, and invite others to be NEAR tech advocates! Let\\\\\\'s build [Peer-to-Peer learning clubs](https://peerlab.community/)!_\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n----\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFeel free to comment your updates and we will post this same post with the updated sections in the future to keep track of our progress on the Rust Developer Journey on NEAR.\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}", "notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"item\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"social\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"tooling.community.devhub.near/post/main\\\\\\\"}}}"}}, "handle": "tooling"}

{"data": {"tooling.community.devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# Are we Rust yet?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nYes, but ...\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRust is the primary language used in the NEAR ecosystem, and the tools in Rust received a lot of love. Still, the Developer Journey for Rust Development on NEAR is not fully delivered even though all the pieces are already there!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Developer Journey of Application Developer on NEAR with Rust/Swift/Kotlin/... experience\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Welcome to NEAR!** - there are welcoming and supportive communities at [DevHub Communities](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities), [Discord](https://near.chat), [Telegram @neardev](https://t.me/neardev), and a number of regional hubs.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges: \\\\\\\\n    * The DevHub Communities catalog is still incomplete and hard to search unless you know the community you need.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s complete the catalog and provide various views on the DevHub\\\\\\'s communities list based on activity, area of involvement, etc._\\\\\\\\n    * Communities are still not discoverable peer-to-peer.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s do a better job of interlinking communities from each other (e.g. make regular posts with useful resources and links to other relevant communities)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2. **Get started** - there are [a number of examples](https://github.com/near-examples/), great local & [online development environment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near-new-project-template) thanks to [interactive CLIs](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), easy-to-use [contracts development framework](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs), and [integration testing framework](https://github.com/near/near-workspaces-rs).\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * There is no high-level picture of how all the tools fit together.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create one high-level map and reference it everywhere._\\\\\\\\n    * There is no recommended crash course into Rust to get productive with contract development.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s select and explicitly recommend to scan through those instead of learning the whole Rust book on day one. Those could be selected chapters from [Rust by example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/), [Google\\\\\\'s Comprehensive Rust Book](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/)._\\\\\\\\n    * Tools do not feature each other, which makes it harder to build a proper mental model.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s improve READMEs to have a unified look and provide references to other tools and relevant communities._\\\\\\\\n    * Testnet environment is not promoted.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s emphasize how it enables rapid experimentation._\\\\\\\\n    * Contract development best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how/when/why to use standards [NEPs], how to get the best out of the local storage, how to deal with data migration after contract upgrades, when it makes sense to use off-chain indexers)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n3. **Go to production** - it is easy to deploy to mainnet thanks to [cargo-near](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), and [NEAR RPC providers](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/introduction), [Indexers](https://docs.near.org/concepts/data-flow/data-storage), [Explorers](https://explorer.near.org), and SourceScan help to be productive and insightful.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * Developers need some NEAR tokens on mainnet to get things deployed.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create some pool with a semi-automated process where developers can come and request some NEAR for the development (public GitHub repo should be required to make the request)._\\\\\\\\n    * Preparing for production best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how to secure your contract account, how to ensure contract upgradability without full access keys, how to react to exploited vulnerabilities)._\\\\\\\\n    * Security considerations are often a major roadblock before going live.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s provide more automated tools to stress the code as much as possible (code coverage, generating tests with AI, etc)._\\\\\\\\n    * Collecting insights about the app usage is still hard.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s explore if RPC providers could offer anonymized aggregated insights about view function calls and some other metrics, chain analytics could also be easier._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n4. **Invite others** - many of us came to NEAR for the great tech and awesome community.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * We rely on the goodwill of our community members spreading the word.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s recognize our most prominent tech advocates, and invite others to be NEAR tech advocates! Let\\\\\\'s build [Peer-to-Peer learning clubs](https://peerlab.community/)!_\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n----\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFeel free to comment your updates and we will post this same post with the updated sections in the future to keep track of our progress on the Rust Developer Journey on NEAR.\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}", "notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"item\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"social\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"tooling.community.devhub.near/post/main\\\\\\\"}}}"}}}}

{"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# Are we Rust yet?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nYes, but ...\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRust is the primary language used in the NEAR ecosystem, and the tools in Rust received a lot of love. Still, the Developer Journey for Rust Development on NEAR is not fully delivered even though all the pieces are already there!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Developer Journey of Application Developer on NEAR with Rust/Swift/Kotlin/... experience\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Welcome to NEAR!** - there are welcoming and supportive communities at [DevHub Communities](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities), [Discord](https://near.chat), [Telegram @neardev](https://t.me/neardev), and a number of regional hubs.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges: \\\\\\\\n    * The DevHub Communities catalog is still incomplete and hard to search unless you know the community you need.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s complete the catalog and provide various views on the DevHub\\\\\\'s communities list based on activity, area of involvement, etc._\\\\\\\\n    * Communities are still not discoverable peer-to-peer.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s do a better job of interlinking communities from each other (e.g. make regular posts with useful resources and links to other relevant communities)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2. **Get started** - there are [a number of examples](https://github.com/near-examples/), great local & [online development environment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near-new-project-template) thanks to [interactive CLIs](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), easy-to-use [contracts development framework](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs), and [integration testing framework](https://github.com/near/near-workspaces-rs).\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * There is no high-level picture of how all the tools fit together.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create one high-level map and reference it everywhere._\\\\\\\\n    * There is no recommended crash course into Rust to get productive with contract development.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s select and explicitly recommend to scan through those instead of learning the whole Rust book on day one. Those could be selected chapters from [Rust by example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/), [Google\\\\\\'s Comprehensive Rust Book](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/)._\\\\\\\\n    * Tools do not feature each other, which makes it harder to build a proper mental model.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s improve READMEs to have a unified look and provide references to other tools and relevant communities._\\\\\\\\n    * Testnet environment is not promoted.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s emphasize how it enables rapid experimentation._\\\\\\\\n    * Contract development best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how/when/why to use standards [NEPs], how to get the best out of the local storage, how to deal with data migration after contract upgrades, when it makes sense to use off-chain indexers)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n3. **Go to production** - it is easy to deploy to mainnet thanks to [cargo-near](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), and [NEAR RPC providers](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/introduction), [Indexers](https://docs.near.org/concepts/data-flow/data-storage), [Explorers](https://explorer.near.org), and SourceScan help to be productive and insightful.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * Developers need some NEAR tokens on mainnet to get things deployed.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create some pool with a semi-automated process where developers can come and request some NEAR for the development (public GitHub repo should be required to make the request)._\\\\\\\\n    * Preparing for production best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how to secure your contract account, how to ensure contract upgradability without full access keys, how to react to exploited vulnerabilities)._\\\\\\\\n    * Security considerations are often a major roadblock before going live.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s provide more automated tools to stress the code as much as possible (code coverage, generating tests with AI, etc)._\\\\\\\\n    * Collecting insights about the app usage is still hard.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s explore if RPC providers could offer anonymized aggregated insights about view function calls and some other metrics, chain analytics could also be easier._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n4. **Invite others** - many of us came to NEAR for the great tech and awesome community.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * We rely on the goodwill of our community members spreading the word.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s recognize our most prominent tech advocates, and invite others to be NEAR tech advocates! Let\\\\\\'s build [Peer-to-Peer learning clubs](https://peerlab.community/)!_\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n----\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFeel free to comment your updates and we will post this same post with the updated sections in the future to keep track of our progress on the Rust Developer Journey on NEAR.\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}", "notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"item\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"social\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"tooling.community.devhub.near/post/main\\\\\\\"}}}"}}, "handle": "tooling"}

{"data": {"tooling.community.devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# Are we Rust yet?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nYes, but ...\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRust is the primary language used in the NEAR ecosystem, and the tools in Rust received a lot of love. Still, the Developer Journey for Rust Development on NEAR is not fully delivered even though all the pieces are already there!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Developer Journey of Application Developer on NEAR with Rust/Swift/Kotlin/... experience\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Welcome to NEAR!** - there are welcoming and supportive communities at [DevHub Communities](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities), [Discord](https://near.chat), [Telegram @neardev](https://t.me/neardev), and a number of regional hubs.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges: \\\\\\\\n    * The DevHub Communities catalog is still incomplete and hard to search unless you know the community you need.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s complete the catalog and provide various views on the DevHub\\\\\\'s communities list based on activity, area of involvement, etc._\\\\\\\\n    * Communities are still not discoverable peer-to-peer.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s do a better job of interlinking communities from each other (e.g. make regular posts with useful resources and links to other relevant communities)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n2. **Get started** - there are [a number of examples](https://github.com/near-examples/), great local & [online development environment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near-new-project-template) thanks to [interactive CLIs](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), easy-to-use [contracts development framework](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs), and [integration testing framework](https://github.com/near/near-workspaces-rs).\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * There is no high-level picture of how all the tools fit together.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create one high-level map and reference it everywhere._\\\\\\\\n    * There is no recommended crash course into Rust to get productive with contract development.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s select and explicitly recommend to scan through those instead of learning the whole Rust book on day one. Those could be selected chapters from [Rust by example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/), [Google\\\\\\'s Comprehensive Rust Book](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/)._\\\\\\\\n    * Tools do not feature each other, which makes it harder to build a proper mental model.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s improve READMEs to have a unified look and provide references to other tools and relevant communities._\\\\\\\\n    * Testnet environment is not promoted.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s emphasize how it enables rapid experimentation._\\\\\\\\n    * Contract development best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how/when/why to use standards [NEPs], how to get the best out of the local storage, how to deal with data migration after contract upgrades, when it makes sense to use off-chain indexers)._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n3. **Go to production** - it is easy to deploy to mainnet thanks to [cargo-near](https://github.com/near/cargo-near), and [NEAR RPC providers](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/introduction), [Indexers](https://docs.near.org/concepts/data-flow/data-storage), [Explorers](https://explorer.near.org), and SourceScan help to be productive and insightful.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * Developers need some NEAR tokens on mainnet to get things deployed.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create some pool with a semi-automated process where developers can come and request some NEAR for the development (public GitHub repo should be required to make the request)._\\\\\\\\n    * Preparing for production best practices are not communicated.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s create a catalog of best practices (e.g. how to secure your contract account, how to ensure contract upgradability without full access keys, how to react to exploited vulnerabilities)._\\\\\\\\n    * Security considerations are often a major roadblock before going live.\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s provide more automated tools to stress the code as much as possible (code coverage, generating tests with AI, etc)._\\\\\\\\n    * Collecting insights about the app usage is still hard.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s explore if RPC providers could offer anonymized aggregated insights about view function calls and some other metrics, chain analytics could also be easier._\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n4. **Invite others** - many of us came to NEAR for the great tech and awesome community.\\\\\\\\n    There are still some open challenges:\\\\\\\\n    * We rely on the goodwill of our community members spreading the word.\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\\n      _Let\\\\\\'s recognize our most prominent tech advocates, and invite others to be NEAR tech advocates! Let\\\\\\'s build [Peer-to-Peer learning clubs](https://peerlab.community/)!_\\\\\\\\n      \\\\\\\\n----\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFeel free to comment your updates and we will post this same post with the updated sections in the future to keep track of our progress on the Rust Developer Journey on NEAR.\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}", "notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"item\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"social\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"tooling.community.devhub.near/post/main\\\\\\\"}}}"}}}}
